description: A sewing club and community garden for elders, sports programs like a basketball league for youth and recreational soccer for adults, pre-employment assistance, support groups for Indigenous parents, a mat and blanket shelter, and more

donations.information: We currently have 20 bags of 10lb rice surplus donations that we like to share with any organization that needs it. Please contact us at 604-123-4567 before coming to pick up. Thank you.

We recently received a very generous donation of 500 pairs of men's winter socks. We would like to share with any organization that needs it. Please contact us at 604-123-4567 before coming to pick up. Thank you.
We accept and manage clothes and blankets on behalf of people in need. Please feel free to drop off clean, bagged clothes at our location on weekdays, Monday-Friday, between 9:30 am and 4:30 pm.

For our dinner service our food needs are very specific and we are conscious of other groups in the community who rely on donations. So what we don’t use for our nightly outreach we donate to the Surrey Food Bank or recovery homes with whom we partner.

description: Drop-in centre and 24-hour emergency shelter, a kitchen that provides 500 meals each day, and Indigenous women’s projects that include Indigenous plant walks, outings for Indigenous women, counselling, cultural and community art projects and workshops.

donations.information: We would like to release 50 packages of pads and tampons and share with any organization that needs it. Please contact us at 604-123-4567 before coming to pick up. Thank you.

We accept and manage sleeping bags and blankets on behalf of people in need. Please feel free to drop off clean, bagged sleeping bags and blankets at our location on weekdays, Monday-Friday, between 9:30 am and 4:30 pm.
We are in need of toilet paper. Please feel free to drop off unopened toilet paper at our location on weekdays.

program_name: Pacific Association of First Nations Women
description: Weekly Zoom drum circles, an elder support program, mentorship programs for youth, Indigenous language classes, home care services, counselling for Indigenous people with missing or murdered family members, an Urban Butterflies program for girls and the PAFNW Awards Fund, which provides postsecondary scholarships for Indigenous women

Two streams of programs—one is youth camps that empower Indigenous kids and teens, the other is a two-day workshop for anyone who works with Indigenous communities (nurses, employers, youth leaders, et cetera) that teaches ways to engage with members

A transformational housing program that offers 16 suites for mothers and children who are at risk of homelessness or child welfare intervention, plus childcare and other programs including parenting workshops, housing and resources workshops, life skills workshops and self-care workshops

donations.description: Provide employment training (life skills coaching, work experience and team-building activities) and leadership training for work in the recreation, child care, cultural and food security fields, offer recreational activities at schools, community centres and parks throughout the city, and organize Indigenous cultural programs in collaboration with community partners

donations.program_name: Kílala Lelum Urban Indigenous Health and Healing Cooperative
donations.description: Partner Indigenous elders living in the Downtown Eastside with health-care professionals to provide physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual care

UNYA has four major program areas—education and training (including an alternative education program for Indigenous youth), health and wellness (including a mediation program, Aboriginal outreach team and clinical counselling), housing and transition (including an Aboriginal youth safe house), and Community and Connection (including mentorship, sports and recreation and a Two-Spirit collective)

donations.program_name: SUCCESS Home Health - Chinese Meals on Wheels
donations.description: Chinese meals delivered daily 11am-1pm by Chinese-speaking volunteers. More info at https://www.carebc.ca/meals-on-wheels.html

donations.program_name: Directions Youth Services - Meal and Snacks
donations.description: Snacks 24/7; Meal Daily 8-9 pm. Intake process to become a client.

donations.information: We have 100 jars of peanut butter that will be expired by the end of next month. We won't be able to use them all. Please feel free to come pick up between 9am to 5pm.

donations.description: A registered not-for-profit society, NightShift today has a volunteer base of more than 2,500 individuals, including community groups and church teams. Nightly outreach happens 365 days a year outside our offices on King George Boulevard. We offer meals, clothing, crisis counselling, basic nursing, a mobile library, prayer and loving community contact. The continuum of care includes ongoing, registered Christian counselling with sliding-scale fees, men’s and women’s support groups, Bible studies, extreme weather response, a clothing ministry (Sisters Thrift Boutique) and much more.

donations.information: We currently have 100 surplus tooth paste donations that we like to share with any organization that needs it. Please contact us at 604-123-4567 before coming to pick up. Thank you.
We are always grateful for donations of lightly used men’s and women’s jeans, hoodies, jackets, new underwear and socks, tops and shoes.
NightShift accepts and manages blankets on behalf of people in need. Please feel free to drop off clean, bagged clothes at our location on weekdays, Monday-Friday, between 9:30 am and 4:30 pm.
